message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.EC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with mechanism design problems, which are typically studied in the game theory (cs.GT) and economics (cs.EC) communities. The focus on procurement auctions with private costs suggests a connection to algorithmic game theory (cs.GT) and combinatorial optimization (cs.DS). The use of submodular functions as a key tool in the analysis points towards machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI), where submodularity has been extensively studied in recent years.
